summary: This is an FBI communication from Miami to Albuquerque regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution. It details the origins of the case from Palm Beach Police, the execution of a search warrant at Epstein's home where evidence was removed, and the recovery of incriminating message pads. It notes Epstein's multiple residences, the development of witnesses nationwide, and a target indictment date of January 2007, while requesting assistance to establish interstate criminal activity.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI investigation for child prostitution. The document details the investigation into his activities, the search of his Palm Beach home, and his multiple residences.

persons.name: SAJ
persons.context: An FBI agent from Miami, West Palm RA, who lead agents are requested to contact for investigative direction regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: SAl
persons.context: Another FBI agent (likely a typo for 'SA' or specific initials) who lead agents are requested to contact for questions regarding the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: SA is the FBI Special Agent from Miami who is drafting/approving the communication regarding the investigation into Epstein for child prostitution.

events.title: FBI Investigation Initiated
events.description: The FBI's Palm Beach County Resident Agency (PBCRA) began investigating Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution based on information from the Palm Beach Police Department.

events.title: Search Warrant Executed at Epstein Home
events.description: The Palm Beach Police Department obtained and executed a search warrant at Epstein's Palm Beach home. Many belongings, including computer CPUs, were removed prior to the search and never recovered. Incriminating telephone message pads were found.

events.title: Target Indictment Date
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorneys and Case Agents set a target date of January 2007 for indictment, citing media coverage, unknown state investigation status, victim vulnerability, and political influences.

keyFacts: Computer CPUs were removed from Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach home prior to the execution of a police search warrant and were never recovered.

Telephone message pads recovered during the search contained explicit messages like 'I have a female for him' and 'has girl for tonight,' which were linked to girls who admitted to sexual activity with Epstein.
The FBI cites 'political influences' as a factor considered by AUSAs and Case Agents when setting a target indictment date of January 2007.
The investigation aimed to establish Epstein's use of interstate commerce to engage in illicit sexual conduct and prostitution, prompting requests for assistance from FBI offices in other states.
Epstein maintained residences in Palm Beach, the U.S. Virgin Islands, New York, and New Mexico at the time of the investigation.
